intro: Tithymalus tshuiensis, commonly known as the Chinese tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soil. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
